paper.title: Unifying Zero-Knowledge Proofs of Knowledge

author.org: Department of Computer Science, ETH Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland, CH

paper.venue: International Conference on Cryptology in Africa
paper.abstract: We present a simple zero-knowledge proof of knowledge protocol of which many protocols in the literature are instantiations. These include Schnorru0027s protocol for proving knowledge of a discrete logarithm, the Fiat-Shamir and Guillou-Quisquater protocols for proving knowledge of a modular root, protocols for proving knowledge of representations (like Okamotou0027s protocol), protocols for proving equality of secret values, a protocol for proving the correctness of a Diffie-Hellman key, protocols for proving the multiplicative relation of three commitments (as required in secure multi-party computation), and protocols used in credential :[87],"shows that a single simple treatment (and proof), at a high level of abstraction, can replace the individual previous treatments. Moreover, one can devise new instantiations of the protocol.
